body:
### Problem

(This is a question about the codebase, not a feature request.)

I maintain [a project](https://github.com/noib3/nvim-oxi) that provides Rust bindings to Neovim's C API, and I'm updating it to track the ABI changes in master vs 0.9.2.

It seems that many of the [`Dict(_)`](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/src/nvim/api/keysets.h) structs now have an `OptionalKeys` field, which I believe [acts as a mask](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/src/nvim/api/private/helpers.h#L68) to determine which fields are set (please correct me if this is wrong, my knowledge of C is limited).

Even though the struct definitions match and I think the masks I'm using are correct, I'm still getting many errors when calling the API from Rust.

For example, [this code](https://github.com/noib3/nvim-oxi/blob/neovim-nightly/crates/oxi-api/src/types/window_config.rs#L342-L367) corresponds to a hardcoded value of `Dict(float_config)` which should be equivalent to `{relative="editor", height=10, width=5, row=1.5, col=1.5}`.

The [struct definition](https://github.com/noib3/nvim-oxi/blob/neovim-nightly/crates/oxi-api/src/types/window_config.rs#L271-L293) matches the one [in Neovim](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/src/nvim/api/keysets.h#L95-L117), and yet calling [`nvim::api::open_win`](https://github.com/noib3/nvim-oxi/blob/neovim-nightly/crates/oxi-api/src/win_config.rs#L9-L23) errors with `'relative' key must be String`. Nothing shows up if I grep the codebase for that message.

The following steps should reproduce the issue (make sure to have a Nightly build of Neovim in your $PATH):

```bash
git clone https://github.com/noib3/nvim-oxi && cd nvim-oxi
git checkout neovim-nightly
cd tests
cargo build --features neovim-nightly
cargo test --features neovim-nightly open_win_basic_config
```

### Expected behavior

N/A.
title: (Question) Having troubles calling the C ABI
